name: BEST WESTERN Premier Opera Richepanse

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: It's hard not to smile when thinking of a visit to Paris, and then having the luck to pick this hotel. It is within a 1 minute walk from Madeline Metro, and 5 minutes from Concorde Metro. The Madeleine church is a block away, Place de la Concorde and the Jardin Tuileries 5 minutes walk. And yet the street is quiet. What more could you want?
reviews.title: Location, location, location, coupled with service, service, and service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides being 10-15 minutes walking distance to the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, the Champs Elysees, Lafayette and Printemp department stores, around the corner from theFauchon luxury food emporium and Laduree macaroon store, it is also just off Rue St. Honore with all it's designer labels and a short walk from Rue Vendome! Great during sales season, but dangerous at any other time. More practically there is a Monoprix convenience store just around the corner open till late, which also stocks sandwiches and tins of foie gras (unethical, yet so tasty...).
reviews.title: Staff are fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel staff was excellent, as everyone else has noted. We arrived after 24 hours of flying at 10am, and our rooms were already prepared (grateful, but unexpected). Check in and check out was easy. The desk staff helpful with maps and directions, and assistance to the airport. The breakfast staff were pleasant. All the desk staff spoke good English, which should rightly embarras all us monolinguals.
reviews.title: Absolutely loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: The rooms were pretty standard, but a good place to sleep. Every now and then you did feel the rumble of a passing metro beneath the hotel, but it certainly didn't wake us from sleep or cause any disturbance. It was almost comforting to know that this hotel was not completely perfect! During humid weather the air conditioning was under powered, but the huge windows all opened to allow air in. The bathroom was of adequate size, and the shower had good water pressure. There was a standard room security safe. Although there were not enough free electrical sockets, there was a powerboard with universal (international) sockets.
reviews.title: superb location, staff excellant and very attentive spotlessly clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009
reviews.text: Breakfast was basic, but reasonably priced (for Paris), and offered reliably cooked and cold food and pastries. Omelettes and espresso coffee is included in the price, but on request. The food was certainly enough to keep us going most of the day.
reviews.title: Great find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed six nights in VIP room #57. The beginning of the stay was bumpy: I'd reserved a non-smoking room and called 10 days in advance to confirm all details. The nice lady even said they'd have room made up early for us b/c our flight arrived so early (6:30 am, putting us at hotel around 9:30am). When we arrived, the room was not to be ready until 2pm, normal check-in time. We did the jet-lag-walk-around and I rested in lobby until room was ready. Unfortunately, the room was a smoking room. The smell was intense and the product used to mask the smell almost as bad. After being told we could not switch rooms, we moved to a much nicer room. It was huge (for Paris) and faced a quiet side (we gave up a modest view of Madeleine church that we had from smoking room). The bathroom was very nice and big. Despite not getting much direct sun, the room was fairly light because of its large floor-to-ceiling windows that open. Coffee pot in room and we used mini fridge for our own goodies. Grocery store close by. Easy walk to Louvre, Metro, Concorde, Orsay and much more. The bed was hard, but that seems to be the way of Europe. Towel warmer in bathroom was nice touch and helpful for the little sink laundry we did. The shopping is very expensive in the area - lots of luxury chains. Myriad cafes in the area - tho those near hotel are way overpriced, beware. The staff was so helpful throughout our stay, especially Jeremy.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great staff, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from this beautiful hotel. Arrived late and where so impressed with warmness of staff. Throughout they were extremely helpful and courteous. We had booked two rooms and were given two adjajent rooms on first floor. They were spotless and overlooked the street. The noise was slightly raised on Saturday due to revellers, but that is to be expected in a city. Really loved the ambience of this hotel, it is a real jewel. I wouldnt, hesitate to return to this hotel.......
reviews.title: "Lovely Hotel"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights recently with my husband. There is very little I could fault it on. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room was small but spotless, with a turndown service every night. The location is excellent- 5 or 10 minutes walk from the main attractions (Louvre, Place de la Concorde, Champs Elysee) and 2 minutes from the metro.
reviews.title: Lovely little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has great character- a refreshing change from impersonal and homogenous hotel rooms.
reviews.title: lovel, friendly,beautiful environment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beware the prices in bars and restaurants nearby however- we had a drink in the bar next door and felt severely ripped off.
reviews.title: Exceptional service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a 2 day break in Paris, and miss it already!!! It was mine and my boyfriends first holiday together, and couldn't of been happier with our choice of hotel. We stayed in the V.I.P. suite and highly reccommend it to other travellers, it exceeded our expectations in size with a toilet and en-suite separate. Maid service was brilliant they came and tidied not only the routine once a day but every time we left (which we really appreciated as we managed to leave it in a tip!) The staff are really helpful and friendly, they reccommended good restaurants (we ate at the italian across the road, which was gorgeous!) also bars and clubs in the area.Unfortunantly we didn't take their advice on which clubs to go to and ended up going out near the arc de triomphe which is unbelievably expensive !! (as students we were shocked when we had to pay 40 euros for a vodka orange and beer!!) The staff also sorted out taxis for us but make sure you go down on time and don't wait until they call your room as taxis will start charging straight away as we normally were already on 10 euros when we got in.The hotel is in an ideal location for anyone who wants to go to Paris for sightseeing or shopping as we walked down to the champs elysees in 10 minutes, which is beautiful. As a young couple on our first holiday it was a perfect choice of location and we really enjoyed our stay and would go back. The only downside is that everything is expensive but that is what you will expect from being in the centre of Paris.
reviews.title: The Perfect Break

likes.liked: — Location, size of room, cleaniness, friendliness.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this hotel. They were extremely friendly.
reviews.title: Friendly, very clean and well located. Lovely really.

likes.disliked: — The shower door in the wrong place.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was nice and so was the hotel. Our room smelled lovely and was so clean.
reviews.title: Excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We came back every night to find our bed turned down with chocolates - Godiva. Haven't had this in a few years - usually only with 5 star hotels.
reviews.title: Fantastic, fantastic hotel!!!

likes.liked: — Location, service, friendliness of staff, cleanliness, comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that was strange was that the shower door was on the wrong side of the bath so the floor got drenched when ever we showered. That may have just been our room and didn't effect us too much.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: staff friendly, very good location close to Madeleine, 3 bed in room, close to restaurants, mgasins, champ elisee, bad in the price + expensive about 250 Euros per day 3 persons
reviews.title: nice location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Within easy walking distance of the metro, main shopping street, and Place de la Concorde and Seine..
reviews.title: Great Location, but very noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very, very noisy - Looks onto a street where youngster come out of a nightclub on Saturday nights and stand around screaming and shouting until 6:am Sunday morning.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Decor in rooms is a bit outdated - they could do with a bit of modernisation.
reviews.title: Great location, friendly staff and very clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Great little privately owned hotel under the Best Western flag, brilliantly centrally located within walking distance of nearly all the attractions and with great metro stations just outside the door Concorde & Madeline lots of good resturants cafe's in the vacinity.
reviews.title: Hidden Gem

aka: Best Western Premier Opera Richepanse Hotel Paris
